member.summary: Used if the key is directly used and not delegated/derived. These have the form `H(public_key) 0x02` (29 bytes)

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.PrincipalType.Derived
member.summary: These ids are treated specially when an id needs to be registered. In such a request, whoever requests an id can provide a derivation_nonce. By hashing that together with the principal of the caller, every principal has a space of ids that only they can register ids from. These have the form `H(|registering_principal| registering_principal derivation_nonce) 0x03` (29 bytes)

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.PrincipalType.Anonymous
member.summary: Used when there is no authentication/signature This has the form `0x04`

member.name: F:EdjCase.ICP.Candid.Models.PrincipalType.Reserved
member.summary: These have the form of `blob 0x7f` (29 bytes) where the blob length is between 0 and 28 bytes
